title: 114_hr1069
content: The Act may be cited as the "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2016" and pertains to Presidential Libraries. The "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2016" amends Section 2112 of title 44, United States Code, by adding a new subsection requiring Presidential library fundraising organizations to report information on contributors who donate $200 or more in a calendar quarter. This reporting requirement continues until specified conditions are met. The Archivist must publish information submitted by Presidential library fundraising organizations on the National Archives website within 30 days of each quarterly filing. Submission of false material information is prohibited. It is unlawful to submit false material information or omit material information with respect to contributions to an organization, with penalties applying as described in section 1001 of title 18, United States Code. It is illegal for a Presidential library fundraising organization to knowingly provide false information or omit material information. Penalties under section 1001 of title 18, United States Code, apply for violations. Additionally, it is unlawful for a person to make a contribution in someone else's name. The Archivist must create regulations to enforce the prohibition of making contributions in another person's name, with penalties similar to violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act. The term 'information' in this subsection refers to the amount or value of contributions, their sources and addresses, contributors' occupations if individuals, and contribution dates. The term 'Presidential library fundraising organization' refers to an organization established to raise funds for Presidential archival depositories. This applies to organizations involved in creating, maintaining, expanding, or conducting activities at such facilities. The term 'Presidential library fundraising organization' refers to an organization established to raise funds for Presidential archival depositories. This applies to organizations involved in creating, maintaining, expanding, or conducting activities at such facilities, but only applies to contributions made after the enactment of this Act. No additional funds are authorized for the requirements of this Act and its amendments. The existing authorized amounts will be used for implementation.
